Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired red and worn) below; exterior: trace of band on edge of rim, reserved below.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1355) (phase 2)
